instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> How is this board even turning on?
threads.message:
Hi.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR> has a hole in it but the board powers and chimes. It will not PRAM reset (it's not the keyboard) but it will SMC reset. I have not bothered to boot it to OS.
Anyone know how this thing is still turning on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> How is this board even turning on?
threads.message:
FORGET IT I'M A RETARD, I did not have the fucking trackpad plugged in before so PRAM will obviously not reset!
Still not sure how it was powering on though.
